channel.title: Apache2 or Lighttpd?
channel.description: Which one is better? I am currently using Apache2, but is Lighttpd any better? Will it support PHP and .htaccess files? Is it any faster?

item.title: Apache2 or Lighttpd?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:5, topic:330715”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=427081.msg3136503#msg3136503 date=1267034162]

Which one is better? I am currently using Apache2, but is Lighttpd any better? Will it support PHP and .htaccess files? Is it any faster?

I use lighttpd here, but I used to use apache. Lighttpd is MUCH faster and does support PHP, but does not support .htaccess files, but really has better alternatives, the configuration is excellent. I love it.
[/quote]
Where can I get lighttpd for Windows? Not the source code for lighttpd, but the binaries, etc.[/quote]

Might want to follow this or another tutorial found by googling on windows:
http://www.winstonyw.com/2008/05/28/installing-lighttpd-and-php-on-windows/

But of course I would recommend you use a decent operating system instead. If you install ubuntu all you have to do is ‘apt-get install lighttpd php5-fcgi mysql-server’ and you have everything up and running in no time.

item.title: Apache2 or Lighttpd?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ollie123:

How else would I go about per-directory configuration?

It is all handled in the single configuration file. I can give you examples if you need specific things. I myself had a few things I handled with .htaccess files but realized most weren’t needed and the few that were I can handle fine with the lighttpd configuration file.
